table-wrap.anchoringText: Therefore, pre-existence fractures along the in-situ maximum principal stress orientation are the first to be reopened. If the pore pressure further arises, pre-existence fractures along other directions are sequentially activated according to their angles from the in-situ maximum principal stress orientation[9]. To study the probability of these two cases, two key pressures – fracturing pressure of intact rock and reopening pressure of pre-existence fracture were calculated (Chart 1).
table-wrap.label: Chart 1
table-wrap.caption: Pressure ranges of two representative low-permeability reservoirs in Ordos basin

formatted-caption.caption-text: Pressure ranges of two representative low-permeability reservoirs in Ordos basin

tr.th: Reopeing pressure (angle from current max stress orientation) Mpa
